short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Remembers your browsing preferences for the GW and FW sites, to make up for their UX

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
The Games Workshop webstore has many localised versions, and which one you get for a given web search appears to be random. Once you're on the webstore, switching locale takes you back to the home page, so you need to search all over again.

This extension stores your locale when you choose it, and thereafter always redirects you to that site regardless of which localised version you were sent to. You can change your locale at any time using the interface on the website, and this will normally allow you to stay on the same page.

This extension also stores your last "View All" or "View less" interaction with a product list page, and uses it to automatically "View All" on any product list if that was what you did last.

Also makes the instagram viewer modals link to people's instagram accounts.

Now works on the Forge World website too ("View All" preference is shared across both sites, but language preference is not)
